current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish the National Prostate Cancer Council for improved screening, early detection,
			 assessment,
			 and monitoring of prostate cancer, and to direct the development and
			 implementation of a national strategic plan to expedite advancement of
			 diagnostic tools and the transfer of such tools to patients.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
(referred to in
			 this section as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Office of the Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (referred to in this Act as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and Monitoring of Prostate Cancer
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
National
			 Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and
			 Monitoring of Prostate Cancer

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and Monitoring of Prostate Cancer

text.#text:
develop and implement a national strategic plan for the accelerated creation, advancement,  and
			 testing of diagnostic tools to improve screening, early detection,
			 assessment, and monitoring of prostate cancer, including—
early detection of aggressive prostate cancer  to save lives;
monitoring of tumor response to treatment, including  recurrence and progression; and

accurate assessment and surveillance of indolent disease to reduce unnecessary biopsies and
			 treatment;

provide information and coordination of prostate cancer research and services across all Federal
			 agencies;

review diagnostic tools and their overall effectiveness at screening, detecting,
			 assessing, and monitoring of prostate cancer;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the creation and implementation of the
			 national strategic plan under paragraph (1); and

text.#text: submit an annual report to the

ensure the inclusion of men at high-risk for prostate cancer, including men from ethnic and racial
			 populations and men who are least likely to receive care, in clinical,
			 research, and service efforts, with the purpose of decreasing health
			 disparities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and Monitoring of Prostate Cancer

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: or designee and comprised of the following experts:

National
			 Institute of Biomedical Imaging and Bioengineering
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Institute of Biomedical Imaging and Bioengineering

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

Director of the Department of Defense Congressionally Directed Medical Research
			 Program
Director of the Office of Minority Health
Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 include 16 expert members from outside the Federal Government, which shall
			 include at least—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and Monitoring of Prostate Cancer

text.#text: In addition to the members described in paragraph (1), the
2 caregivers of prostate cancer patients; and

2 representatives from national prostate cancer disease organizations that fund research or have
			 demonstrated experience in providing assistance to patients, families, and
			 medical professionals, including information on health care options,
			 education, and referral; and

8 health care stakeholders with specific expertise in prostate cancer research in the critical
			 areas of clinical expertise, including medical oncology, radiology,
			 radiation oncology, urology, and pathology.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall meet quarterly and meetings shall be open to the public.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and Monitoring of Prostate Cancer
National Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and Monitoring of Prostate Cancer

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall submit annual reports, beginning not later than 1 year
			 after the date of enactment of this Act, to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: National Prostate Cancer Council on Screening, Early Detection, Assessment, and Monitoring of Prostate Cancer

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or the
			 Secretary’s designee and to

text.#text:
an evaluation of all federally funded efforts in prostate cancer research and 
			 gaps relating to the development and validation of diagnostic
			 tools	for prostate cancer; and

recommendations for priority actions to
			 expand, eliminate, coordinate, or condense programs based on the
			 performance, mission, and purpose of the programs; and

National Institute on Minority Health and Health
			 Disparities

Office on Minority Health of the Department of Health
			 and Human Services

text.#text:
an analysis of the disparities in the incidence and mortality rates of prostate
			 cancer in men at high risk of the disease, including individuals with
			 family history, increasing age, or  African-American heritage; and
a review of the progress towards the realization of the proposed strategic plan.
